column4: grrr something is jamming my sound driver and i cant figure out the problem
i was just listening to something playing on vlc i close it and now i cant play anything else
if i dont use pulseaudio, that happens if i have a browser open like firefox (it locks my audio). also happens with amarok and VirualMachines etc (anything that could use sound)
ooook so mind running me through getting pulse audio to replace alsa? i atempted this once before and it led to disaster and me uninstalling every reference to pulse audio
all i did was System>Preferences>Sound then change the first 3 on the devices tab to PulseAudio
yeah but pulse audio isnt listed there any more

since playing with it when i was using SL buggered my sound system on a repeated basis i went through system package manager and uninstalled every reference to pulse audio i could find and installed everything alsa

when i use alsa, i notice issues with the sound locking, so if i was playing amarok music, then open youtube, i cant listen to youtube. i changed to pulseaudio (on the suggestion of someone else) and now i can listen to both at the same time, but i dont know why it doesnt work for u :( sorry
i didnt ever notice issues with alsa until hardy
didnt notice issues with npviewer until hardy eithere
intrepid is out at end of october
doesnt help me now does it
spomething is jamming the sound drivers and i cant remember hpw to find out what
i had that problem with fiesty and i made a fix, dont know if it pertains to your issue
just interested in fixing my sound atm. i have a fix for my flash and npvier problems
